attributes.action: Year 10s should not have to sit GCSEs next year
attributes.additional_details: The Government should cancel GCSEs and give out a predicted grade to all students.
attributes.background: Year 10s should not have to sit their GCSEs because they have had to much time off school to work on the GCSEs.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament. You can read the decision made by exam boards on what will happen to exams this year here:  https://www.gov.uk/government/news/further-details-on-exams-and-grades-announced   

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
